issues.description: The `Rideable` interface in the solution defines `messageOnRide(int speed)`, but both the problem statement UML and the template’s `Main.java` expect a no-argument `messageOnRide():String`. This parameter mismatch will confuse students and break the intended calls to `messageOnRide()` with no arguments.
issues.suggested_fix: Align the `Rideable` interface with the problem/template by removing the `int speed` parameter. Define `String messageOnRide()` without parameters and update all implementing classes accordingly.

issues.description: The `Rideable` interface’s `messageOnRide` method is specified in the problem statement (and UML) as `messageOnRide(): String` (no parameters), but in the solution repository `Rideable.java` declares `messageOnRide(int speed): String`, and the implementing classes (`Pig`, `Seal`) likewise use a `speed` parameter and include “at X mph” in the return. This mismatch will confuse students when mapping the required method signature and output format from the problem to the provided solution.
issues.suggested_fix: Change the `Rideable` interface signature in the solution to `String messageOnRide()` (no parameters) and adjust `Pig` and `Seal` implementations to match that signature and return exactly “Riding on [Animal Type] [name]”.
